snippet: Dartmouth is concerned that Advanced Placement courses are not as rigorous as college courses.
abstract: Dartmouth College will stop giving credit in 2018 for students who scored well on high school Advanced Placement tests, arguing that AP courses are not as rigorous as their college counterparts.
lead_paragraph: Dartmouth is concerned that Advanced Placement courses are not as rigorous as college courses.

headline.main: Dartmouth Stops Credits for Excelling on A.P. Test
headline.print_headline: Dartmouth Stops Credits For Excelling On A.P. Test
